trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an operation is attempted on a transaction that has already been rolled back, or an attempt is made to commit the transaction and the transaction aborts.

This exception is thrown when an action is attempted on a transaction that has already been rolled back, for example, when you attempt to call the <xref:System.Transactions.CommittableTransaction.Commit%2A> method on a transaction that has already timed out.
This exception is also thrown when an attempt is made to commit the transaction and the transaction aborts.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Transactions.TransactionAbortedException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Transactions.TransactionAbortedException"></xref> class with the specified message.
A <xref:System.String> that contains a message that explains why the exception occurred.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Transactions.TransactionAbortedException"></xref> class with the specified serialization and streaming context information.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that describes a failed serialization.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that describes a failed serialization context.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Transactions.TransactionAbortedException"></xref> class with the specified message and inner exception.
A <xref:System.String> that contains a message that explains why the exception occurred.
Gets the exception instance that causes the current exception.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*> property.
